92d69356888def73292f22ecf4e73836 (13:30): Introvert: just did it on my laptop.  just have to pass the arguments 'dolvm2 real_root=/dev/vgx/lvolx' using a genkernel created initrd

70f45953215274030c9265f0fc3b3eaf (13:30): rockdonus: otherwise i have to use the ugly bloated ndiswrapper way to get wifi to work

92d69356888def73292f22ecf4e73836 (13:31): Introvert: i got ultra-paranoid about raiding after i lost a hdd, and lvm is a marketable skill

874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:32): rockdonus: with a prism card? You *should* be able to get that to work the standard way. Have you checked out linux-wlan's site? They have a FAQ/Instructions. http://linux-wlan.org/

874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:35): rockdonus: as I don't use linux-wlan, I don't know.  Why not just try the actual key?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:35): rockdonus: if you fear the imminent explosion of your box, I assure you, testing out different keys won't do it

fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:40): ok onto the next problem, neddyseagoon always help me to get rid of this one
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:41): sexy-heli sbin # modprobe nvidia
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:41): FATAL: Error inserting nvidia (/lib/modules/2.6.16-gentoo-r7/video/nvidia.ko): Unknown symbol in module, or unknown parameter (see dmesg)
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:41): nvidia: Unknown symbol remap_page_range
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:41): nvidia: Unknown symbol pci_find_class
3fd02d71a2d5802c0b0b3699ccc763b2 (13:41): Don't modprobe it
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:43): francois: have you built the module? *emerge nvidia-kernel*
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:43): yes Shirakawasuna i have and the verions are this
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:43): francois: if you have, does /usr/src/linux point to the current kernel you're running?
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:43): Shirakawasuna: this is a new install
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:43): only one profile
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:43): francois: uname -r && ls -l /usr/src
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:43): and yes it does
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:43): francois: ok
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:44): nvidia-kernel ->       Latest version installed: 1.0.6629-r5
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:45): nvidia-glx ->       Latest version installed: 1.0.6629-r7
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:45): neddyseagoon always tell me something to do
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:45): francois: it's usually better to use the latest ~x86 possible
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:45): *with nvidia*
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:45): occasionally support for older cards is dropped, but unless you have one of those stay w/ ~x86 nvidia-kernel/glx
3fd02d71a2d5802c0b0b3699ccc763b2 (13:46): francois: Configure xorg.conf to load it (Don't modprobe it) and use the latest ~x86
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:46): francois: indeed, "nvidia" should be the video driver in your xorg.conf
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:46): Introvert: why not modprobe? and how do i configure xorg.conf with it ... here is my current xorg.conf http://xploiting.org/gentoo/xorg.conf
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:48): francois: you should be able to modprobe nvidia, so just try upgrading your nvidia-kernel/glx packages

b597d58b26162e407180e225376a9a3f (13:50): if there is an delay wen pressing the keyboard wen i use X, what is missing in the xorg.conf? anyone?
fe3a0100072f34506f80a4331ecd2863 (13:50): HEHE I had my bash_history uploaded somewhere
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:50): francois: echo "media-video/nvidia-kernel ~x86" >> /etc/portage/package.keywords
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:50): francois: same for "media-video/nvidia-glx"
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:50): francois: echo "foo" >> "bar" amens foo to the end of the file bar
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:51): francois: the line 'media-video/nvidia-kernel ~x86' will enable portage to emerge the latest ~x86 nvidia-kernel packages available
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (13:51): silly boy
